content.question: There is an electric field along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis given as a function of position <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> by the equation <math alttext="E sub x equals negative 75 x newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>âˆ’</mo><mn>75</mn><mi>x</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the difference in potential between point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 2 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 7 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and which point is at the higher potential?

choices.label: <math alttext="75 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>75</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is at the higher potential.

<math alttext="385 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>385</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is at the higher potential.

<math alttext="385 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>385</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is at the higher potential.

<math alttext="1690 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1690</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is at the higher potential.

<math alttext="1690 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1690</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is at the higher potential.

content.answer: <math alttext="1690 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1690</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is at the higher potential.

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
